project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Symptom
Some project queries may mess up when there exist two projects in JIRA when the one's name equals to another one's key. for example: 
ProjectA:
Name = IT Support
Key = _SUPPORT_

ProjectB:
Name = _Support_
Key = SPT

Then there're the multiple places that may mess up in project queries:
* Go to [Project Progress Gadget|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+the+Project+Progress+Gadget|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Browsing+a+Project%27s+Issues] for "Support", when clicking on the sum number, the navigation results show the project "IT SUPPORT"
* Go to Planning Board for "Support", when clicking on the issue navigation on version panel, the navigation results show the project "IT SUPPORT"

h4. Cause
JIRA JQuery gives project key the higher priority in criteria matching, so when GH uses project name in JQuery - "project=SUPPORT", the project with key matched will be allocated.

h4. Workaround
Since project key can't be changed after project is created, user may adjust the project name to avoid this problem, i.e. change project "SUPPORT"(SPT) to "General Support"(SPT). 

h4. Resolution
It's better to check and make sure all project queries are based on project ID or Key instead of searching on name.
fields.summary: Project queries may mismatch when one project's name equals to another one's key

fields.description:
To reproduce, add a gadget (for example, the hour burndown gadget) to Confluence.

When the necessary configuration is entered directly into the macro body, it works fine, so it's only the configuration step that is broken.

The Card View, Hour Burndown and Project Progress gadgets are affected.
Agile and Days Remaining gadgets are not affected.
I couldn't find the Cumulative flow and Statistics gadgets, so they should be assumed broken.

fields.description:
*Symptoms*
The "Time Remaining" calculation, especially after a sub-version is released, appears different for different logged in users.

*Cause*
The context is being pulled from the _Chart Board_, not the _Planning Board_.

*Workaround*
Set the correct context in the chart board, then revisit the planning board.
fields.summary: Time Estimate is inaccurate for different logged in users due to context being pulled from Chart Board, not Planning Board

fields.description:
Current Context filter _Agile>Context>Manage>Filter>"Assignee " Field_ is sort by Fullname, while showing username in the "Assignee" Field. This causes field showing un-sorted username.

The field should showing Fullname if sorted by Fullname, or showing username if sorted by username to avoid confusion it might caused.
fields.summary: Context filter "Assignee(s)" field should show Fullnames instead of usernames

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Examples of two ways we would use this feature:

1. Display the Unscheduled backlog on one side and the current sprint on the other. 
Currently at sprint planning meetings we have to drag all the stories we want to add out of the backlog and into the sprint. Then we have to open up the sprint and prioritize them there. It would cut our planning time in half if we could drag stories directly from the backlog to the correct priority position in the current sprint.

2. Display the current sprint on one side and the next one on the other.
At the end of the sprint, any stories that were not completed have to be dragged to the next sprint. Then we have to open up the next sprint and reprioritize them. By default, the stories we drag over are added to the bottom of the list. Often the stories we drag over are the highest priority because they are gating issues and must be completed before other stories can be worked on. Again, it would save us a lot of time if we could just drag them to their exact place in the new sprint they need to go.
fields.summary: Ability to view side-by-side backlogs by version on the planning board and drag issues between them

fields.description:
This is affecting our ability to upgrade to Jira 4.1 since we would be introducing this new unexplained behaviour which affects all our figures.

Attached a screenshot showing the issue. Notice how the start date is the 3rd September, and yet the graph is displayed from 
(I'm guessing) 3 days before that day.

I've tried searching for this but couldn't find any similar issues.
fields.summary: Burndown chart starts before specified date and therefore displays wrong data

fields.description: Using JIRA Enterprise Studio I am trying to change the project template for a given project. In red letters it states 'All changes will be saved automatically' but when I change the project template from 'Default' to 'Scrum' this change does not persist. If I navigate away from this page and then return, the settings has reverted to Default. However, changes I make to General Configuration does however appear to be saved. I checked the check box for 'Scheduling Permission' and on my return to it persists.
fields.summary: Changes are not saved when configuring GreenHooper Project Templates

fields.description:
COS:
- Java and REST API
- Document this
- Allow the rank of an issue to be updated
- Write ref app to test

-------------
Uploading new numeric values to the ranking field directly (via SOAP or by manually specifying form arguments) fails.

In JIRA Client, we have a reordering functionality, similar to Greenhopper's, which can be supported by numeric values in a custom field. The user would rearrange issues, JIRA Client calculates numeric values for the order, and then tries to upload them to the server (either via SOAP RPC, or through Edit Issue HTML forms).

This used to work with Greenhopper's Ranking field very nicely. As of version 5.1, 5.2 (probably 5.0 too), it stopped working. If I upload a new Ranking value, it is ignored.

As much as I could gather, you have changed the semantics of the new uploaded value. It used to be exactly the value of the field, as with other normal fields. Now it seems to be exactly the ranking value of another issue, which is desired to follow the one being changed. (Please confirm - is that correct?)

If I may suggest a way to fix this, could you please:
1. Accept any numeric value X for ranking
2. If X matches the ranking value of any issue, act exactly as you do now
3. Otherwise, find the issue that has minimal ranking that is greater than X, and use it as the base issue similar to case 2.

In other words, instead of using "Issue[Rank=X]", use "Issue[min(Rank>=X)]" as the base issue for the change.

That way, the functionality would be more robust and compatible. (I understand the final value may be different from the uploaded one, but I think remote clients can cope with that. Also, you could take the exact uploaded value as a "hint" for the new value of the ranking field.)
 
Thanks!
Igor
fields.summary: As a Plugin Developer I would like to update the Rank of an issue using an API

fields.description:
QUICK DESCRIPTION:
When GreenHopper is used in JIRA, it should be possible to make an screenshot of the end/start of sprint (iteration or version in JIRA terminology).

LONG DESCRIPTION:
Currently there is no way to know, what was the initial and final state of sprint (if I move some stories/tasks from SPRINT1 -> SPRINT2, this information can not be captured). For example, we have iteration SPRINT1 with stories S1 (tasks T11, T12), S2 (T21, T22), S3 (T13). This is initial view of the sprint. During sprint execution, S2 and S3 are DONE, but in S1 only T11 was resolved). So when iteration SPRINT2 is constructed, S1 is moved from SPRINT1 to SPRINT2 (only T12) and T13 is added. Which information is lost:
- initial state of SPRINT1 (if I look at it S1 will be missing)
- final state of SPRINT1 (I should see, that T11 was done already in SPRINT1)
- where did T13 appear (was already present in SPRINT1 or was it added in SPRINT2

I can construct all this by clicking each individual task but this is manual approach that takes alot of time.

fields.description:
We need a possibility to have some time sheet for calculating total available hours for people during the sprint, like the one you can see in the attachment. This sheet could be similar to an already existing JIRA Timesheet Plugin (https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/TIME/JIRA+Timesheet+Plugin), but must be editable.

We have used this in our sprint backlog planning with Excel, because some of the people in the team are not available or partially available on some of the days during the sprint (because of day offs or any other reason) and this sheet just reflects that. With this information we are able to estimate more accurately and calculate the total amount of available time.

Furthermore we are able to draw the ideal estimate line closer to the reality (see attachment), which shouldn't be just a straight line as it is currently in the GH. For example if you have a two week sprint and you know that half of the team is unavailable on the first week for any reason, then there's no way you can match the ideal line and also you don't know whether you are right on track or not. With the ideal line reflecting the exact amount of time available on particular day, you are able to keep track on the progress whether you are meeting the schedule or not.

We're certainly missing such functionality here and this prevents us (Blocker priority) from switching from Excel+Bugzilla to JIRA+Greenhopper. Is there any way to implement this?
fields.summary: Configuration of burndown chart ideal line with planning of total available hours in the sprint

fields.description:
We are drowning in tasks, and collecting them into some sort of hierarchy would be one way of managing them. Epics seem like the natural way to create a hierarchy, but they're not visible enough in the planning board.

What I would like is to view a tree hierarchy of my epics which I can expand and collapse - e.g.

[-] Do funky stuff
..[-] Funky feature 1
....[-] funk task
....[-] funk task 2
..[-] Funky feature 2
....[-] funk task A
[-] Do boring stuff
..[-] Boring feature 1
....[-] Boring task
..[-] Boring task 2
..[-] Boring feature 3
....[-] F3 part 1
......[-] Boring stuff
......[-] More boring stuff
....[-] Tedious stuff

I want to be able to expand and collapse the epics so I can control whether I view their sub-tasks.
I want to be able to drag and drop tasks/epics/... onto epics to make them children of the drop target.
I want to be able to rank epics against other epics at the same level of hierarchy.

However, I want to manage epics which span multiple iterations, and are in parallel with other epics which also span multiple iterations...

Not sure how epics should be ranked when sub-issues are ranked interleaved with each other - maybe the parent should be ranked before the first child at all times.  If a child gets dragged earlier, the epic moves with it.

Having the epic tree view to give coarse ranking will speed up the prioritisation process, and being able to collapse epics will speed up bringing new tasks to the top of the priority when there is a long list of tasks.

This reproduces functionality which I would get if I used Rally or VersionOne.

[We're still on 4.3 because we our JIRA has dependencies on Plugins which don't yet support JIRA 4.1, so the sysadmins won't upgrade JIRA, so we can't upgrade Greenhopper, but I can't see anything in the Greenhopper list or documentation which suggests this has been implemented in 5.x]

Cheers,

Ian
fields.summary: As a GH user, I want to work with a tree view of my epics within the planning board

fields.description:
1. Go to Administration -> (Green Hopper) -> General Configuration
2. Check the Card Background Colour checkbox
3. Go to Administration -> (Green Hopper) -> Project Templates -> Card Styles
4. Tick the Enable background colour by default checkbox
Result: the selected issue type colour scheme changes to show background colour
5. Select a different issue type
Result: the selected issue type colour scheme changes to not show a background colour
6. Unselect Enable background colour by default
Result: the selected issue type colour scheme changes to show background colour

The colour scheme does not change on the task board, however.
fields.summary: Enable background colour by default - selection is not enabled when changingissue type

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This enhancement would be to allow the user to enter in a number of sprints for a particular release and have the GreenHopper planning board display a visual indication (possibly just a line) to show which backlog features/tasks/etc. would be projected to be a part of the release.  One way to accomplish this would be by using the numbers from the burndown chart that show how many story points are being completed per sprint and then use that to project the number of story points that would be completed within the user defined number of sprints.

For example, if you are at the end of sprint 3 and have completed 105 story points (35 per sprint) and you enter 5 sprints then there would be a visual indication underneath the prioritized list of features/tasks/etc that shows the top 175 story points worth of work (35 per sprint * 5 sprints).  This would be very useful in communicating to product owners what they will get if they want to ship after sprint 5 versus sprint 7, for example.
fields.summary: Ability to display projected feature set

fields.description: At present, as far as I can tell, the y-axis of the CFD shows just number of issues. At least for me, NUMBER of issues is really not a reasonable measure of AMOUNT of work in progress. Ideally all issues would be roughly similar in size, but in practice that is rarely the case. Much more useful would be an axis that showed a variable metric, such as hours or story points.

fields.description:
Internet Explorer 8 shows performance issues with Greenhopper 5.0 and above. Upon clicking "New Card" the performance decreases dramatically, mostly noticeable by keyboard input lag. Other tested browsers such as Firefox, Google Chrome or Safari do not show this behavior.

Workaround:
If you turn on Compatibility Mode it will switch browser engine to a modified version of Internet Explorer 6 and will run faster, but still with some keyboard input lag. However, turning on Compatibility Mode will also invoke all of Internet Explorer 6's caveats. It could be that parts of your JIRA instance will not perform as requested due to the dropped Internet Explorer 6 support.
fields.summary: Performance issues with IE8

fields.description:
We have upgraded today from GreenHopper 5.1 to the latest version 5.2. When we look up the chart board as a "Hour Burndown Chart" for a lot of versions we get only the red guide line, however, the first version shows all lines. This is particularly awkward as we use the "Required daily burndown rate" to adapt our release plans. The chart was fine before the upgrade.

In the log fine we receive the following message for three issues of the last release that displays okay:
{noformat}
2010-08-18 12:12:26,785 http-8443-9 WARN goeckeler 732x237x1 zj1xhv 10.0.0.15,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/ChartBoard.jspa [greenhopper.service.charts.DefaultHour
BurndownChartService] Failed to compute remaining estimate for sprint start with planning and work log on the same day: VSP-409, 2010-06-30T00:00:00.000+02:0
0
{noformat}

We cannot find any details in the online documentation for this issue, nor does any editing on the issues change anything. The sprints look fine, all dates are set and make sense, Still the error message is displayed.
fields.summary: Failed to Compute Remaining Estimate for Sprint Start with Planning and Worklog on the Same Day

fields.description:
In current version, when swtiching to a specific Board Mode, GreenHopper automatically applies the Context that is selected by user at the last visit for this Board Mode. However, it's not convenient in some cases, for example the below scenario is from a GreenHopper user, who applies Context as the main refine tool in GreenHopper, and found that sticking to the last Context selection is cumbersome in his workflow, especially after involving Assignee Mode.

{quote}
I am interested in our This iteration context (linked to this iter jira query), Planning board, Project overview to see what everyone is doing.
Then I decide to change from overview to Assignee = John to see what he is doing this iteration.
However the last time I used assignee was on the Planning context so the context switches back to Planning (planning jira query). I did not want this, so I change the Context back to This iteration. 
Put more simply I use Mode to refine the context that I am looking at. When mode changes the context it breaks this work flow.
{quote}

So, it should be helpful to allow user to select the default Context for Board Modes in User Preferences; for example, provide users with the below options:
* Apply the "Default" Context
* Stick on the last Context selection
* Set default Context for each Board Mode manually, ...
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like configure default Context for each Board Modes in User Preferences

fields.description:
The 'Reporter' field, if required on the 'Workflow Screen' and 'Resolve Issue Screen' (see relevant 'Default Field Configuration' settings in Screenshot.png), is not handled appropriately by GreenHopper.

Presumably, if a use-case existed where the assignee or project lead wished to change the reporter on the 'Workflow Screen,' 'Resolve Issue Screen' or any other screen which is used with/by GreenHopper in transition, the following problem occurs:

* On the Task Board, when the project lead drags an issue from, say, "In Progress" to "Done" (Resolved), GreenHopper displays the reporter field (expected), but does not allow the value to be edited... 

* Also, the value of the reporter field changes to the current user (initiating the transition). I would expect a widget similar to what is seen in JIRA alone.

This does not occur in JIRA if following the same transitions.

Attached also is GHBug.png showing what it looks like from the perspective of 'Anonymous Administrator'. Lastly, attached is an XML dump (GHBug.zip) of a vanilla JIRA install with GreenHopper 5.0 (the problem exists in 5.1 too, from my tests). The XML dump has a configured 'Project X' and all one needs to do to reproduce from there is drag the issue PROJX-3 from 'In Progress' to 'Done.'

Please let me know if you have further questions or require more information.

Be well,

Jason Hammons
Support Engineer - San Francisco
fields.summary: When required reporter field is on workflow screen, value not editable in GH transition, value changed to current user

fields.description:
Referring to the documentation below:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH044/GreenHopper+Installation+and+Upgrade+Guide#GreenHopperInstallationandUpgradeGuide-UninstallingGreenHopper

The uninstall Greenhopper plugin the step should be:
# Remove the GreenHopper Ranking type custom field via _Administration > Issue Fields > Custom Fields_
# Unchecked the GreenHopper Night Service via _Administration > GreenHopper > General Configuration_
# Remove the GreenHopper's JAR file from <JIRA_HOME>/plugins/installed-plugins


If the user missed the first step, they need to remove the GreenHopper Ranking type custom field from the database manually which is a bit risky even though it is easy.


Cheers,
Janet
fields.summary: Missing step in the Uninstalling Greenhopper documentation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently iterations can only be represented in the version hierarchy, this can be problematic as it's not possible to look at iterations across the hierarchy, for example consider the following, which is typical of our version hierarchy.

major deliverable
   milestone 1
      milestone 1_iteration 1
      milestone 1_iteration 2
   milestone 2
      milestone 2_iteration 2
      milestone 2_iteration 3
      milestone 2_iteration 4
   milestone 3
      milestone 3_iteration 3
      milestone 3_iteration 4

Because iterations need to be represented as separate versions and a team might work on multiple milestones in an iteration we can't see a consolidated view of an iteration.

It would be great if iterations and versions could be conceptually separated to allow a view on iteration and milestone hierarchy.  Currently we shoe-horn iterations into versions to make this work, but we loose all the date based functionality and releasing which isn't ideal.
fields.summary: Iterations to be represented outside the version hierarchy
